results.title: Mortgage
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Bruce Moir and Bill Bennett
results.brief_description: An absorbing docu-drama about a young couple who, in trying to buy and build a house, find themselves in a spiralling nightmare world of deceit, incompetence and rising interest rates. The film shows the couple’s growing awareness and acceptance of emotional and financial responsibility. Like the companion films Custody and Malpractice this is a cautionary tale in the form of docu-drama, offering no easy answers or simplified dramatic conflict, instead seeking to create a sense of lived experience while dramatising the issues involved. The key characters are played by actors with architects, solicitors and government services officials playing themselves. Cast includes Doris Younane, Brian Vriends, Bruce Venables and Andrew Gilbert.

results.title: Mortal thoughts
results.creator_credit: New Visions Pictures, Polar Film, Rufglen Films, Joseph Caracciolo Jr, John Fiedler, Mark Tarlov and Alan Rudolph
results.brief_description: Cynthia and Joyce are childhood friends who get involved in the gruesome death of Joyce’s abusive husband in a moment of passion. The two conspire to cover up the crime, which leads to an intricate web of lies and a cycle of accusations and double-crossings. Alan Rudolph plays out this neo-noir drama within a working class milieu, replete with New Jersey accents and drab surrounds. Demi Moore and Glenne Headly are two hairdressers caught between the loyalties that their lifelong friendship demands and the terror of being accused of murder. Headly gives an absorbing performance as Joyce, a woman trapped in an impoverished, miserable state with an overbearing, insensitive, drunkard of a husband. Harvey Keitel plays a hard-boiled detective who unravels the mystery of James’ death by interrogating Cynthia, who reveals the past through a series of extensive flashbacks.

results.title: Mort D'un Guide = Death of a Guide
results.brief_description:
In July 1974, Michel Servoz, a mountain guide based in Chamonix and his trainee, Patric Falavier, are reported missing in the Massif des Drus. Merinchal, a journalist who had previously interviewed Servoz, decides to cover the search and rescue operation. When he reaches Chamonix, he realises that Servoz and Chevalier were not on an ordinary training run but were attempting to open a new way to the top of the Drus. This made for TV film details with a documentary precision the close knit community of moutain guides. It contains stunning rock climbing sequences.

Credits: Director, Jacques Ertaud ; writer, Henry Grange ; photography, Rene Vernardet, Louis Miaille, Georges Orset ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Victor Lanoux, Pierre Rousseau, Georges Claisse, Jean Valmont.

results.title: Morris loves Jack
results.brief_description:
Morris loves Jack - or does he?
Jack is a young, dedicated policewoman who lives with Morris, a charming but lazy layabout. But he has become a habit she can’t break and so she puts up with the frustrations and disappointments of living with him - until one night the police are called to a noisy party…Cast includes Kris McQuade, John Hargreaves, Bill Hunter and David Boyd.
